page.title: 12Conservation And Climate
page.content: An average summers day in the North West of England is about 72F.We have a lot of rain because the clouds blown in from they Atlantic sea have to rise to get over the Pennine mountains.As the clouds rise they get colder and let out the rain.Our climatic conditions are ideal for growing trees and so we have lots of greenery.A green conservation area near to us is Runcorn Hill.In the 19th century Runcorn Hill was a quarry then in the Victorian times it was used as a rubbish dump.In the early 1900's many people were out of work so they lanscaped Runcorn Hill and made it into a recreation area.Today people can use Runcorn Hill and the surrounding area for a walk or birdwatching.
